Recommended Reason: Sacred lake of the Muisca people, site of El Dorado legend with documented gold ceremonies
Supporting Evidence: Historical attempts to drain the lake recovered gold artifacts; Spanish chronicles document gold offerings

Location: San José Galleon Wreck, Caribbean Coast
Recommended Reason: Spanish treasure galleon sunk 1708, estimated $17 billion worth of gold, silver, and emeralds
Supporting Evidence: Confirmed location discovered 2015, Colombian government plans recovery operations

Recommended Reason: Multiple Spanish treasure fleet wrecks from colonial period, major Caribbean shipping route
Supporting Evidence: Historical records of numerous shipwrecks laden with South American gold and silver

Recommended Reason: Ancient Tairona city with potential gold artifacts and ceremonial objects
Supporting Evidence: Archaeological site shows evidence of sophisticated goldsmithing culture

Recommended Reason: Heart of Muisca civilization known for exceptional goldworking, numerous burial sites
Supporting Evidence: Gold Museum in Bogotá contains thousands of Muisca artifacts from this region
